intro: Trimezia fulva, commonly known as the golden groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Trimezia fulva thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features include hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
